In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is an implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    result = ""
    current_line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        result *= " $word"
        current_line_length += length(word) + 1
    end
    
    return result
end

# Example
text = "This is a sample text that needs to be wrapped at a certain width"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, text_width=15)
println(wrapped_text)
```

You can adjust the `text_width` parameter to see how the function wraps the text accordingly.
